intro: Silene verticillata, commonly known as the whorled catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are opposite and arranged in whorls, giving it a distinctive appearance. Silene verticillata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
